channel.title: CVE Feed for GTKWave -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for GTKWave -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-36747|2024-08-02T16:52:54.211Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: Multiple heap-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the fstReaderIterBlocks2 fstWritex len functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .fst file can lead to memory corruption. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns the handling of `len` in `fstWritex` when `beg_time` does not match the start of the time table.

item.title: CVE-2023-35992|2024-08-02T16:37:40.616Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: An integer overflow vulnerability exists in the FST fstReaderIterBlocks2 vesc allocation functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115, when compiled as a 32-bit binary. A specially crafted .fst file can lead to memory corruption. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2023-35995|2024-08-02T16:37:40.665Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: Multiple improper array index validation vulnerabilities exist in the fstReaderIterBlocks2 tdelta functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .fst file can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns the tdelta indexing when signal_lens is 1.

item.title: CVE-2023-35704|2024-08-02T16:30:43.962Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the FST LEB128 varint functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .fst file can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns the fstReaderVarint32WithSkip function.

item.title: CVE-2023-36916|2024-08-02T17:01:09.992Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: Multiple integer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the FST fstReaderIterBlocks2 chain_table allocation functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .fst file can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns the allocation of the `chain_table_lengths` array.

item.title: CVE-2023-35702|2024-08-02T16:30:44.312Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the FST LEB128 varint functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .fst file can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns the fstReaderVarint32 function.

item.title: CVE-2023-35959|2024-08-02T16:37:40.642Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: Multiple OS command injection vulnerabilities exist in the decompression functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted wave file can lead to arbitrary command execution. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns `.ghw` decompression.

item.title: CVE-2023-34087|2024-08-02T16:01:53.892Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: An improper array index validation vulnerability exists in the EVCD var len parsing functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .evcd file can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2023-34436|2024-08-02T16:10:07.190Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: An out-of-bounds write vulnerability exists in the LXT2 num_time_table_entries functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .lxt2 file can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2023-36915|2024-08-02T17:01:09.987Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: Multiple integer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the FST fstReaderIterBlocks2 chain_table allocation functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .fst file can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns the allocation of the `chain_table` array.

item.title: CVE-2023-35997|2024-08-02T16:37:41.115Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: Multiple improper array index validation vulnerabilities exist in the fstReaderIterBlocks2 tdelta functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns the tdelta indexing when signal_lens is 2 or more.

item.title: CVE-2023-35057|2024-08-02T16:17:04.278Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: An integer overflow vulnerability exists in the LXT2 lxt2_rd_trace value elements allocation functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially crafted .lxt2 file can lead to memory corruption. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger this vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2023-35956|2024-08-02T16:37:40.529Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: Multiple heap-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the fstReaderIterBlocks2 VCDATA parsing functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A specially-crafted .fst file can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns the decompression function `fastlz_decompress`.

item.title: CVE-2023-35969|2024-08-02T16:37:40.526Z -- gtkwave -- gtkwave
item.description: Multiple heap-based buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in the fstReaderIterBlocks2 chain_table parsing functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A victim would need to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.This vulnerability concerns the chain_table of `FST_BL_VCDATA` and `FST_BL_VCDATA_DYN_ALIAS` section types.
